abstract: Filipino government is debating how to defend country against China’s encroachment on West Philippines Sea; options include inviting United States Navy back to Subic Bay naval base, from which it was expelled 25 years earlier; nation has been alarmed by Beijing’s aggressive transformation of South China Sea reefs into military bases, as well as ramming of Filipino vessels and new territory claims.
lead_paragraph: With China pressing its claim to a vast expanse of sea west of Subic Bay, the Philippines is debating whether to welcome the United States Navy back to its old base.

headline.main: Warily Eyeing China, Philippines May Invite U.S. Back to Subic Bay
headline.print_headline: Warily Eyeing China, Philippines May Invite U.S. Back to Subic Bay

snippet: With China pressing its claim to a vast expanse of sea west of Subic Bay, the Philippines is debating whether to welcome the United States Navy back to its old base.
